ygData.subject: quiting eq
ygData.msgSnippet: I quit EQ about 2 months ago and I think it was one of the best decisions I have ever made. I was a complete addict, I played atlest 9 hours a day, even school
ygData.messageBody:
I quit EQ about 2 months ago and I think it was
one of the best decisions I have ever made. I was a
complete addict, I played atlest 9 hours a day, even
school nights, I let it take over my life. I was able to
get a paladin to lvl 55, win roll on CoF, win roll on
granite face grinder, and many other high end items. I
also got a cleric to 47, and started him on collecting
gear from hate. Overall, I put in too much time into
something that doesnt give back. I could have been working
out, studying, working, anything, but no, I was
sitting on my computer playing EQ.<br>Dont get me wrong,
everquest is the most fun and most involved game I have
ever played in my life, but not without a cost
=/<br><br>Anyone whos life was a little like mine, and you are
thinking of quiting, I highly suggest it. You will go out
more, and have more fun in general. I used to get
stressed like crazy, like while raiding naggy or PoF, and
the server would go down. I about pulled my hair out
and broke down over a game =/ Pretty pathetic. Now I
just keep in touch with all of the friends I made, and
do the things I used to do when i was "normal"
=)<br><br>by the way, my name is bob =)<br>im a new member
<br><br>gotta head out, have a great day<br><br>bob d
